Module project.chenlin_17
Package project.chenlin_17.Controller

Class GameOverScreenController

java.lang.Object
project.chenlin_17.Controller.GameOverScreenController
public class GameOverScreenController extends Object
This class is the controller of the game over page
Version:
Version1.0
update: December 28th
Author:
Lin CHEN

  • Constructor Details

    • GameOverScreenController

      public GameOverScreenController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This function is intended to initialize the game over board.
      It contains the node adjustment to the whole pane.
      It contains the reading and setting of the Top 5 player records from the file.
      It contains the initialization of the button click music.

    • setLocation

      private void setLocation(int rank)
      This function allows the arrow to directly points to the player's score by making the calculation.
      If the player gets a very good mark and be in the Top 5's list, the arrow will point to the player's position in the newly updated rank board.
      If the player's current score is not in the Top 5's list, then the arrow would point to the place under the rank board.
      Parameters:
      rank - stands for the player's rank

    • setTransition

      private void setTransition(javafx.scene.Node node)
      This function is aimed at making twinkling animation for the record.
      Parameters:
      node - stands for the twinkling one

    • setGameStatus

      public void setGameStatus(int i, Record record)
      This function is used for accepting the user's game status passed from the finished game playing scene and is used for initializing the current game board.
      Parameters:
      i - stands for the player's game status, whether die or win
      record - stands for getting the player's record after the game have been finished

    • scoreCalculatoin

      private void scoreCalculatoin(Record myRecord)
      This function make the calculation for the user's rank after the finished round.
      If the user plays well, his current record will be inserted in the Top 5 rank list.
      If the user's score is not high enough to be in the rank board, his score would be shown below the rank board and rank board will not be updated.
      Parameters:
      myRecord - receives the users

    • showRank

      private void showRank(String record, javafx.scene.layout.HBox hbox)
      This function shows the text view of the player's recording by getting its rank.
      Parameters:
      record - contains the user's name score and played time
      hbox - container for showing the score

    • screenJustify

      private void screenJustify()
      This function is intended to set the layout for scene components and achieves the goal of resizable.

    • getSceneRoot

      public javafx.scene.layout.Pane getSceneRoot()
      This function allows other class to get the pane and components for this page. It's useful when the WorldController knows the game has been ended and needs to show this page.
      Returns:
      the draw pane for this page

    • SaveThisRecord

      public void SaveThisRecord(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This function allows the player to save the record when they are satisfied. If he is not satisfied the record will not be saved in the permanent file.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - catch the mouse click event done by the user

    • BackToMenu

      public void BackToMenu(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This function allows the player to go back to the main menu when he finishes playing and see his scores.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - catch the mouse click event done by the user

    • loader

      private javafx.scene.image.Image loader(String fileName)
      This is a helper function to load the files
      Parameters:
      fileName - load file's name
      Returns:
      Image built with specified file name
